medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 1 month due to poor feeding and failure to thrive, leading to a diagnosis of congenital hypopituitarism. GH therapy was initiated at age 4 years, lasting until 18 years of age. The patient exhibited normal pubertal development starting at age 12 years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital combined pituitary hormone deficiency (CPHD) involving growth hormone (GH), prolactin (PRL), and thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) deficiencies.
medical_history.family_history: Patient's mother was heterozygous for the S179R allele; father's status was not investigated.
